body: it also work find on fastjson.

Thank you for the report -- I got the email and had a look at linked to explanation.
Seems legit.
maybe this one will get 3 CVEs : )

Block added, will be included in:

* 2.9.10
* 2.10.0.pr2 (and final 2.10.0)

also backported in 2.8 branch but not sure if any more releases for 2.8 will be made.

issue.title: CVE-2019-14439: bump jackson-databind to 2.9.9.3

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-http
repository.description: The Streaming-first HTTP server/module of Akka

issue.body:
PR https://github.com/akka/akka-http/pull/2671 bumps the `jackson-databind` version to 2.9.9. However, this version is susceptible to CVE-2019-14439 (original issue: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2389). While the vulnerability might not be directly exploitable from Akka HTTP, it might still pose a problem for projects pulling it in as a transitive dependency.

This PR bumps `jackson-databind` further, to its latest stable version, 2.9.9.3.

FYI, there are three more CVE's of this kind present in all versions of `jackson-databind`, including this one - they will be fixed in the forthcoming 2.10.0 release:

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2410
https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2420
https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2421

labels.description: Issues related to public CVEs (security vuln reports)

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Another gadget (*) type report regarding `HikariConfig` (sub-class of `HikariDataSource`)

Mitre id: CVE-2019-14439
Reporter: kingkk

Fixed in:

* 2.9.10
* 2.8.11.5
* 2.6.7.3
* does not affect 2.10.0 and later

-----

(*) See https://medium.com/@cowtowncoder/on-jackson-cves-dont-panic-here-is-what-you-need-to-know-54cd0d6e8062 for more on general problem type

body:
When is 2.9.10 being released?

issue.title: Update Jackson to 2.9.10 when available and remove exclusions for CVE-2019-14540

repository.name: unirest-java
repository.description: Unirest in Java: Simplified, lightweight HTTP client library.

issue.body:
Note that Jackson is only a ```test``` dependency of core Uniest-Java. It is a full dependency of the `object-mapper-jackson` plugin.

Also in neither case do we enable default typing (see https://medium.com/@cowtowncoder/on-jackson-cves-dont-panic-here-is-what-you-need-to-know-54cd0d6e8062)

This issue is a reminder the patches should be available in two weeks https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/2410
